intro: Teramnus botrydium, commonly known as the clustered teramnus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Teramnus botrydium is often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops, thriving in well-drained soils.
